```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(smithCEE2025)
```

Load the data
```{r load_data}
boston <- retrieve_output()
```

Look at the object
```{r examine}
boston
```

You can plot several ways: just by cell id
```{r plot_base, fig.width=5}
plot(boston)
```

Or by a specific feature
```{r plot_base2, fig.width=5}
plot(boston, feature = 'albedo_new')

```

And you can zoom in on a specific day
```{r plot_base3, fig.width=5}
plot(boston, feature = 'max_temp_daymet_C', hod = 14, doy = 153)
```
